body: I'd like to test this on Kokoro first. Unfortunately, we can't easily run performance tests on forks like we could with Jenkins. Can you push this to a branch on grpc/grpc and I'll trigger a full performance build?
You can't trigger a build against this branch on my fork?
Nevermind, I guess it is possible. I triggered a build to test it and it's under the Adhoc Performance commit status.

```
Now using node v9.11.1 (npm v5.6.0)
++ dirname tools/run_tests/performance/build_performance_node.sh
+ cd tools/run_tests/performance/../../../../grpc-node
tools/run_tests/performance/build_performance_node.sh: line 24: cd: tools/run_tests/performance/../../../../grpc-node: No such file or directory
2018-04-30 20:47:50,408 FAILED: remote_host_build.grpc-kokoro-performance-server-8core [ret=1, pid=5372, time=341.9sec]
```

The issue is that grpc-node isn't on the remote workers. We scp the gRPC repos from the driver to the workers, so I think you need to add grpc-node to https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/7542ba6e0caee740f124dc25706287fd62f546d8/tools/run_tests/run_performance_tests.py#L197 and that should fix this.
The adhoc performance test shows some failures, but it seems to be at least partly a BigQuery problem and I don't see any node-specific failures.
